item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The GTA III port for the Dreamcast has been released (121 points | 24 comments)
2. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (164 points | 124 comments)
3. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (146 points | 100 comments)
4. Morris Chang and the Origins of TSMC (105 points | 26 comments)
5. How to monitor your local weather with Grafana (118 points | 32 comments)
6. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (262 points | 79 comments)
7. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (201 points | 150 comments)
8. Show HN: Watch 3 AIs compete in real-time stock trading (120 points | 96 comments)
9. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (546 points | 183 comments)
10. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (275 points | 207 comments)
11. Legion Health (YC S21) Is Hiring ( | hide)
12. Dinner for One: the British comedy Germans have been laughing at for years(2018) (56 points | 34 comments)
13. Darktable 5.0.0 (231 points | 75 comments)
14. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (303 points | 116 comments)
15. App Should Have Been a Website (and Probably Your Game Too) (131 points | 185 comments)
16. Reciprocal Approximation with 1 Subtraction (71 points | 27 comments)
17. I wrote a Game Boy Advance game in Zig (295 points | 108 comments)
18. The History of Cholera in Great Britain (1947) (5 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: Onramp Can Compile Doom (48 points | 8 comments)
20. Show HN: Handwritten Christmas Card for Hacker News (23 points | 9 comments)
21. AI companies cause most of traffic on forums (440 points | 290 comments)
22. Peephole optimizations: adding `opt_respond_to` to the Ruby VM, part 4 (4 points | discuss)
23. “A Course of Pure Mathematics” – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (270 points | 70 comments)
24. Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (192 points | 48 comments)
25. Agentarium: Creating social simulations with AI Agents (67 points | 23 comments)
26. Ruby-refrigerator: Freeze all core Ruby classes (107 points | 37 comments)
27. Why it's hard to trust software, but you mostly have to anyway (90 points | 93 comments)
28. What Happens to Relicensed Open Source Projects and Their Forks? (88 points | 25 comments)
29. Storing 3D scans in a grain of wheat (11 points | 1 comment)
30. Orbit by Mozilla (401 points | 349 comments)
